ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: incredible class, if you know what you want to get out of it

Overall I found the course very interesting and enjoyed hearing from the guest speakers. In the future, it might be good to try to get a speaker who is from a developing country, working on the ground there in a small NGO, although I understand how this would be logistically challenging.

The course was very aloof and run by students, therefore not viewed, in general, as seriously as other courses. Having taken the Independent Study which complements this course was an important aspect of making it useful. I think this course alone did not substantially benefit students, being a pilot and not having regular assignments or readings or exams.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: the nebulous nature of it allows for you to tailor learning towards an issue you're passionate about or a career path you're considering
Hearing from guest speakers in a variety of fields.
The numerous speakers and the design of the 3 credit project assignment
Professor Geballe is wonderful!
The course provided a variety invited speakers related to the new global agenda

Thinking about implementation and not theory was great! I enjoyed the panelists and the semester long project a lot. I liked the relaxed atmosphere with room to shine or blend in. It was open to everyone. I also really enjoyed the deep dive into the SDGs
External speakers and forum

Interaction with many professionals who came to give guest lectures. Also, topical nature of the subjects discussed. Lastly, the trip to the Paris COP as part of one of the foundations of the topics covered in class.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Honestly, what needs most improvement is getting students to show up to class every day, on time. Oftentimes, I felt embarrassed on behalf of my peers because a guest speaker would be there, ready to talk to the class, and there would only be 5 students in the room, many more of whom would trickle in late. I felt that it reflected poorly on the university. Obviously, though, this is the students' responsibility and has nothing to do with the professor or the teaching of the course.
Finding a logical and integrated way to teach all concepts
The class should be better organized for the coming year.

If the course provided office hours it would be helpful for student who take 3 credits on formulating their SDGs paper/implementation plan. More lesson learnt how was different goal of MDGs achieved would be beneficial to allow student understand the limitation/obstacles on implementing the global agenda.

I think there were too many guest speakers at one given time. A short class with more than one speaker prevented deep discussions from occurring. It would have been nice to have had more time with them. I think FES could have benefited from our project presentations. It would have been nice to have presented in burke to the whole school, or who ever came for pizza! A lot of the students, along with myself put a lot of work into our projects and presentations, a larger audience seemed more fitting. It would have been nice to review to worked with an existing action plan throughout the semester: critiquing it, reading it, etc.
Overall course structure and outline
There needs to be a more solid basis established, and there needs to be more leadership of a professor/s as opposed to the students.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: helped me think about career paths

For someone who hopes to work in international development, this course is crucial. It gives students a better understanding of the SDGs and allows us to talk and think critically about how they will be implemented.

Was very eager to learn about implementation strategies for the sdgs as I will perhaps be able to apply similar strategies for the inplementation of green chemistry technogies in industry and society.
This class allowed me to learn about the process for how to implement a health project, which is relevant in the public health field.
This course was really helpful on giving me an understanding of the SDGs and what things have to considered in term of the implementation of the goals.
I want to work with sustainability. This course was a perfect fit!
It gives an overview of some of the current environmental goals and targets

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I was considering a career in the UN
It was only one credit, so I could take it alongside 4 other courses, and I thought it would be interesting and not a huge time commitment to hear from the guest speakers.
i wanted a class where I could have the freedom to work on a project that would interest me and that I could later use as a foundation for a future job offer.
I want to have an understanding of the new global agenda and how to implement it.
I strongly desired to become intimately familiar with the SDGs. I also wanted to learn more about implementation.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: For the most part, yes. I think it would have been beneficial to have someone from the business sector talk more about drawing up an implementation plan.
Yes, although it is difficult to integrate learning due to the format of the course.

Yes and No. I learned more about economics and environmental issues that I probably would not have been exposed to otherwise. I just wish we would have been thought more about implementation tools to use for our projects.
Yes, the course meets my expectation. The course gave me a better understanding of the SDGs, especially by providing eminent speakers related to the goals.
With no expectations to start, I don't have much to compare it to but, overall I learned a lot about the SDGs and a lot from the various speakers.
Yes
See above, not very much. I learned much, much more in my Independent Study that took aspects of this course, rather than the course itself.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: be proactive with what you want to do your project on
I only took the one-credit version of the course and I wish I had taken the accompanying independent study as well.
Take the 3 credit option and interact with all speakers.
It would be better to take this class if you have a specific topic you are interested and want to explore more in depth.

This course would really helpful for you, especially for those who want to have a carrier in government sector. this course will allow you to understand the SDGs. it would also beneficial if you take 3 credits, so you can implement the mean of implementation suggested by the goals into the real world problems you considered or interested in.
Take it as a 4 credit Independant Study. Go big or Go home!

The course is very "do-it-yourself" and independent rather than monitored. If this suits you, then it's a good course. If you are looking for something more structured and clearly defined then do not take this course. Either way, I would advise taking this course together with an Independent Study with the Professor.
